item.description: In the final installment of this three part series, we are going to use our results from the previous two posts to construct a fully automated variable leverage ETF. In part one, we derived the optimal leverage ratio for maximizing returns and in part two we applied the ARMA and GARCH models to forecast returns and volatility, respectively.

item.title: Steven Gerhardt-King - Asking a stranger to watch your stuff at Starbucks doesn't make any sense
item.description: ‚ÄúHey can you watch my stuff for a second?‚Äù ‚Äì A person at Starbucks before they go to the bathroom For game theory reasons, asking one stranger at Starbucks to watch your laptop while you run off to the bathroom is a bad idea. Here‚Äôs what doing so presumes: There are people at Starbucks looking for unattended property and hoping to snag it OR There are people who aren‚Äôt actively looking for unattended stuff but once they see it, they decide it‚Äôs too good an opportunity to pass up so they take it.

item.title: Blazor RenderTree Explained

item.title: JUNETEENTH WORLD WIDE CELEBRATION
item.description:
Juneteenth
is the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the ending of
slavery in the United States.¬† Dating back to 1865, it was on
June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major
General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news
that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free. Note
that this was two and a half years after President
Lincoln‚Äôs Emancipation Proclamation - which had become official
January 1, 1863. The Emancipation Proclamation had little impact
on the Texans due to the minimal number of Union troops to
enforce the new Executive Order. However, with the surrender of
General Lee in April of 1865, and the arrival of General
Granger‚Äôs regiment, the forces were finally strong enough to
influence and overcome the resistance.
